page.title: 01Dundridge and Surrounds
page.content: This area is predominately agricultural with many acres of rolling countryside. Autumn sown wheat and barley, few fields fallow. Many hedges and small deciduous copses. The pastures are maintained for beef and cattle, mainly Herefords, black with white faces; not many dairy herds, Fresian and some flocks of sheep, Suffolk Cross, large white lowland breeds. Fields are kept for hay cuttings and recently silage has become very popular, stored in sound bales in polythene sacks. Some homes have a few sheep grazing in an orchard and a number of hens, ducks and or geese. The outskirts of a country town has council owned properties and residential houses, in the country the houses are larger than town workers cottages. The main employment is farming related with Portsmouth,
